title: Arsenal predicted line-up for Europa League clash with Vitoria Guimaraes
text:
Get the biggest Arsenal FC stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Arsenal will be without Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and David Luiz for the Europa League visit of Vitoria Guimaraes as Unai Emery opts to rest the pair.

Neither trained on the eve of the Group F clash, although Alexandre Lacazette was involved and looks set for a first start since undergoing ankle surgery in September.

Emery is likely to shuffle his pack for the game, although it remains to be seen whether there is any place in the squad for Mesut Ozil, who has been controversially sidelined by the Gunners boss of late.

Gabriel Martinelli is to start after scoring two goals in Arsenal's 4-0 win at home to Standard Liege in their most recent Europa League game.

Martinelli replaced Pepe with 12 minutes left of Arsenal's 1-0 defeat to Sheffield United on Monday but looks likely to be restored to the starting line-up.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Kieran Tierney also looks set to start after missing the Blades reverse. Left-back Tierney was another who started the Standard Liege game last time out in the competition.

Hector Bellerin, Rob Holding, Lucas Torreira, Dani Ceballos and Emile Smith-Rowe are also set to be in the starting line-up.

Vitoria face Arsenal bottom of Group F and without a point, but head coach Ivo Vieira insists they will go on the attack.

The Primeira Liga side are yet to score a goal in this season's competition, with a defeat at Standard Liege followed up with a narrow home reverse to Eintracht Frankfurt.

(Image: PA)

Arsenal, on the other hand, welcome their Portuguese opponents while sitting pretty at the head of the group having dispatched Frankfurt and Liege with comfortable 3-0 and 4-0 victories, respectively.

Vieira is keen to target three unlikely points at the Emirates Stadium, saying: "We are all focused, despite not scoring our characteristics will grow and we will do our best to win.

"We are playing a strong team tomorrow but we have to believe we can win for the 15,000 fans coming tomorrow.

"We have got to fight and do our best, we have come here to attack and we have come here to win.

(Image: PA)

"To have most of the possession and consistently have the ball, that is what we are aiming to do.

"The more we have of the ball, the more is possible and that is what we are going to be doing.

"Arsenal are doing well in the league, they are a strong team, we can't take that fact away, it will be a difficult game but we want to come away with a win."

Arsenal predicted line-up vs Vitoria Guimaraes: Martinez; Bellerin, Mustafi, Holding, Tierney; Torriera, Willock; Ceballos; Smith-Rowe, Martinelli, Lacazette.
description: Gunners without Aubameyang and Luiz but Lacazette, Martinelli and Tierney to return to starting XI
